Package fr.sorbonne_u.components.ports

Interface PortI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Remote
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    DataInboundPortI, DataOutboundPortI, InboundPortI, OutboundPortI, TwoWayPortI<TWI>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDataInboundPort, AbstractDataOutboundPort, AbstractDataTwoWayPort, AbstractInboundPort, AbstractOutboundPort, AbstractPort, AbstractTwoWayPort, DynamicComponentCreationInboundPort, DynamicComponentCreationOutboundPort, IntercessionInboundPort, IntercessionOutboundPort, IntrospectionInboundPort, IntrospectionOutboundPort, Node_AccessPointCommInboundPort, Node_AccessPointCommInboundPort, Node_AccessPointCommOutboundPort, Node_AccessPointOutboundPort, Node_AccessPointRoutingInboundPort, Node_AccessPointRoutingInboundPort, Node_AccessPointRoutingOutboundPort, Node_RoutingCommInboundPort, Node_RoutingCommInboundPort, Node_RoutingCommOutboundPort, Node_RoutingOutBoundPort, Node_RoutingRoutingInboundPort, Node_RoutingRoutingInboundPort, Node_RoutingRoutingOutboundPort, Node_TerminalCommInboundPort, Node_TerminalCommInboundPort, Node_TerminalCommOutboundPort, Node_TerminalOutBoundPort, ReflectionInboundPort, ReflectionOutboundPort, RegistrationInboundPort
    public interface PortI
extends Remote
    The interface PortI provides for a common supertype for all ports in the component model.

    Description

    In the component model, a port represent an entry point through which components can be connected using connectors. On the implementation side, ports are objects through which a client component calls its provider components, and also through which a provider component is called by its client components.

    Invariant

     invariant      isDestroyed() == (getOwner() == null)
 invariant      !isDestroyed() || getOwner().isPortExisting(getPortURI())
 invariant      !isDistributedlyPublished() || isPublished()
 invariant      getOwner().isInterface(getImplementedInterface())

    Created on : 2011-11-07

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

      boolean connected()
      check whether or not the port is connected to some connector.
      void destroyPort()
      destroy this port and removing it from the ports known to the owner component

      connect the port where the owner is calling its port to initiate the connection.

      connect the port where the owner is calling its port to initiate the connection.
      void doDisconnection()
      disconnect the port where the owner is calling its port to initiate the disconnection.
      String getClientPortURI()
      return the URI of the client port in the connection enabled by this port.
      Class<? extends ComponentInterface> getImplementedInterface()
      return the interface implemented by this port on behalf of the component.
      ComponentI getOwner()
      return the component that owns this port; if not, the port has been destroyed and must not be used anymore.
      String getPortURI()
      return the unique identifier of this port.
      String getServerPortURI()
      return the URI of the server port in the connection enabled by this port.
      boolean isDestroyed()
      return true if the port has been destroyed, false otherwise.
      boolean isDistributedlyPublished()
      return true if the port has been distributedly published.

      connect when the other component is the initiator of the connection.
      void obeyConnection​(String otherPortURI, String ccname)
      connect when the other component is the initiator of the connection or called by the owner after it has requested the connection from the other component.
      void obeyDisconnection()
      disconnect when the other component is the initiator of the disconnection.
      void publishPort()
      publish the port both on the local and the global registry.

      void unsetServerPortURI()
      sets the URI of the server port to which this port is connected.
